bibl.title: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, April 1, 1952

div1.p: Clemons thanks Hench for a copy of an article on Walter Reed by James H. Bailey. He is impressed by the author's range of knowledge.

div1.head: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, April 1, 1952

opener.dateline:
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
1 April 1952

div1.p:
It was pleasant to receive
a note from you, and I much appreciate the copy
of The Virginia Cavalcade which followed.

We are glad to have this
copy of the article on Walter Reed by James H.
Bailey. Of the history of the University of
Virginia during the years immediately following
the War Between the States I have recently made
some study, and the author of the article has
impressed me by his knowledge of the facts and
by his imaginative reconstruction of the Walter
Reed story.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Harry Clemons
Librarian
Retired To Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
102-110 Second Avenue SW.
Rochester, Minnesota
